title: Mount Cobetas
text:
Mount Cobetas (<a href="Spanish%20language">Spanish</a>: "Monte Cobetas"; <a href="Basque%20language">Basque</a>: "Kobeta Mendi") is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in the city of <a href="Bilbao">Bilbao</a>, <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. It is located southwest from the city center and stands high. It raises between the neighborhoods of Altamira and Zorroza, both located in the district <a href="Basurto-Zorroza">Basurto-Zorroza</a>. It was refurbished in 2005 and became the largest park of the city, with an area of . On the top stands the ruins of the Altamira Fort, used during the <a href="Spanish%20Civil%20War">Spanish Civil War</a>.
It is known locally as the location of the open air <a href="music%20festival">music festival</a> <a href="Bilbao%20BBK%20Live">Bilbao BBK Live</a>, that takes place during the first weekend of July.
